meanings.definition: Occurring, active, or flourishing in the evening.
meanings.sent1: The vespertine stars twinkled in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The vespertine walk in the park was peaceful.
meanings.sent3: The vespertine owl hooted a bedtime lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The vespertine garden bloomed under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The vespertine glow of the sunset painted the horizon.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or occurring in the evening.
meanings.sent1: The vespertine breeze carried a coolness through the air.
meanings.sent2: The vespertine colors of the sky were breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The vespertine concert under the stars was magical.
meanings.sent4: The vespertine charm of the town came alive at dusk.
meanings.sent5: The vespertine calm settled over the city as night fell.

meanings.definition: Blooming or opening in the evening.
meanings.sent1: The vespertine flowers released a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent2: The vespertine jasmine bloomed under the moon.
meanings.sent3: The vespertine petals danced in the evening breeze.
meanings.sent4: The vespertine garden glowed with twilight blooms.
meanings.sent5: The vespertine blossoms whispered secrets in the dark.
